intro: Graphorkis concolor var. alphabetica, commonly known as the Alphabetica Orchid, is a rare and unique variant of the Graphorkis genus. It is characterized by its striking, alphabet-shaped petals that give it its distinctive name. This orchid thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and vibrant, colorful blooms that appear during the wet season. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
